3.1. Basic CSS¶

  1. This is an introduction to some basic CSS concepts which changes the look and feel of the page for the user.
  2. CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheet.
  3. It describes how HTML Elements are to be displayed on the screen.
  4. External Style Sheets are stored in CSS files.

3.1.1. CSS Selectors¶

3.1.2. Element Selector¶

  1. It selects the element based on element name.

3.1.2.1. Syntax¶

p {
    color: red
}

3.1.3. ID Selector¶

  1. It selects the element based on its ID. To select the specific id, use a hash # character followed by the id of the element.

3.1.3.1. Syntax¶

#id1 {
     color:red;
}

3.1.4. Class Selector¶

  1. It selects the element based on the class specified.
  2. To select a class, use a dot . character followed by the name of the class.

3.1.4.1. Syntax¶

.class1 {
     color:red;
 }
  1. You can also specify that only certain HTML element with that class should be affected and not all the elements of that class as below :
p.class1 {
     color:red;
}
  1. This will only change the text color of <p> element with class class1 and leave rest of the elements unchanged who have class as class1.

3.1.5. Grouping Selectors¶

  1. You can group the elements having same styles in a single group by using a comma , operator as below :
p, h1, h2 {
     color:red;
}

3.1.6. CSS Comments¶

  1. To mark comments in CSS we use /* Comment */ pattern
